title: Power to the People: Reclaiming Your Energy Sovereignty
summary: Step 2 in exiting systems of dependence: building backup power, creating energy options, and removing the threat of total dependence on a grid that was never built with your sovereignty in mind.

Power.summary: Generate and store your own power to reduce grid dependence.

level0: Audit home energy use with Kill-a-Watt meter
Test powering one device for 24 hours with battery bank
level1: Learn to cook without grid (solar oven, propane, rocket stove)
Power fridge or modem for 24 hours without grid
level2: Install reclaimed solar panels with DIY inverter system
Design modular system starting with one room
Add battery storage for peak rate arbitrage
level3: Build whole-home solar system with 3-5 days backup
Achieve energy independence from utility grid

Knowledge.summary: Learn the skills and understanding needed for energy independence.

level0: Identify 1-2 critical systems to keep running during outages
Learn about utility rate structures and peak hours
level1: Research local solar incentives and regulations
Learn basic electrical safety and wiring
level2: Study inverter and battery system design
level3: Master solar system installation and maintenance

Money.summary: Reduce energy costs and build wealth through energy independence.

level0: Reduce vampire loads with smart plugs and power strips
level1: Source reclaimed solar panels at $35-60 each
Calculate payback period for solar investment
level2: Join neighborhood bulk purchasing for solar equipment
Use time-of-use rates to save money
level3: Help neighbors access affordable solar solutions
